Vegetarijanka je postala mesarka
Med tretjo nosečnostjo ji je zadišalo meso. Zdaj z možem na kmetiji redita prašiče.
07 Nov 2019, 07:32 by B. K. P.



Nikdar več ni pomislila na to, da bi se vrnila k vegetarijanstvu. FOTO: Instagram



Na svoji kmetiji lepo skrbi za živali. FOTO: Instagram



Odločila se je, da bo redila prašiče, čeprav ji svinjina na začetku ni preveč dišala. FOTO: GULIVER/GETTY IMAGeS


Tami Jonas je bila deset let predana vegetarijanka. Mesu se je odrekla, ko je kot mladenka prebrala knjigo o osvoboditvi živali ter si ogledala nekaj dokumentarnih filmov o tem, kako trpijo pod rokami človeka ter v kakšnih nehumanih razmerah živijo v klavnicah. Nato pa je Tami v tretje zanosila in kot mnogo nosečnic je tudi ona dobila neustavljivo željo po določeni vrsti hrane.


Odločila se je, da bo redila prašiče, čeprav ji svinjina na začetku ni preveč dišala. FOTO: GULIVER/GETTY IMAGeS

To pa niso bile kisle kumarice, kot se rado dogaja, temveč hamburger. Nekaj časa se je želji upirala, a ko ta ni in ni splahnela, se je odločila, da posluša svoje telo in si privošči mesni priboljšek. »Pri prvih dveh nosečnostih nisem imela teh težav, nisem si želela nobene čudne hrane, sploh pa ne mesa. A v tretje je bilo drugače. Postala sem nevarno slabokrvna in kljub prehranskim dopolnilom se moje stanje ni izboljšalo. Takrat se mi je tudi pojavila neustavljiva želja po rdečem mesu,« je povedala Tami, ki ji je bil hamburger, ki ga je pojedla po desetletju neuživanja mesa, tako všeč, da je vegetarijanstvo v trenutku postalo preteklost.


Na svoji kmetiji lepo skrbi za živali. FOTO: Instagram

»Nekaj časa je trajalo, da sem začela jesti svinjino in perutnino, a govedini se nisem mogla več upreti, tudi jagnjetina mi je bila strašno všeč in moje zdravje se je nenadoma izboljšalo. Počutila sem se odlično, saj sem dala telesu, kar je potrebovalo,« dodaja Tami. Kljub temu da je prekinila vegetarijanski način prehranjevanja, pa je bila previdna, ko je izbirala meso in vedno se je raje odločila za lokalno pridelano, toliko bolje, če je živinorejca osebno poznala. In ker je odrasla na kmetiji, se ji je nekega dne porodila zamisel, da bi jo imela tudi sama. A ne le to, odločila se je za živinorejo.»Prašiči so bili logična odločitev zame, saj so ene izmed živali, s katerimi pridelovalci mesa najslabše ravnajo,« je dejala Tami, ki se je v Avstralijo pred desetletji preselila iz Združenih držav Amerike. Z možem sta kupila malo kmetijo in začela holistično pristopati do živinoreje, predvsem pa s svojimi živalmi ravnata etično.
10 let je bila Tami vegetarijanka.
»Mnogi bodo rekli, da ubijanje nikdar ne more biti etično, a sama se s tem ne strinjam. Če ubijemo žival, ki jo nato ljudje pojedo, to ni neetično, a le če je imela pred tem dobro življenje,« pravi Tami, ki živali ne le redi, postala je tudi mesarka. Na svoji kmetiji uživa že osem let in nikdar več je ni zamikalo, da bi se vrnila k vegetarijanstvu.
text:
The vegetarian became a butcher
During her third pregnancy, she smelled meat. Now she and her husband farm pigs.
07 Nov 2019, 07:32 by B. K. P.



She never thought of returning to vegetarianism. PHOTO: Instagram



She takes good care of the animals at her farm. PHOTO: Instagram



She decided to raise pigs, even though the pork didn't smell too much at first. PHOTO: GULIVER / GETTY IMAGeS


Tami Jonas has been a devoted vegetarian for ten years. Mesa gave up when she read a book about the liberation of animals as a young woman, and watched some documentaries about how they suffer at the hands of humans and under what inhumane conditions they live in slaughterhouses. Then, Tami became pregnant in the third, and like many pregnant women, she too received an irresistible desire for a certain type of food.


She decided to raise pigs, even though the pork didn't smell too much at first. PHOTO: GULIVER / GETTY IMAGeS

These were not pickles, as is the case, but a burger. For a while, she resisted the urge, but when she did not and did not frighten, she decided to listen to her body and afford a meat treat. "I didn't have these problems in my first two pregnancies, I didn't want any weird food, not meat at all. But in the third it was different. I became dangerously anemic and despite my dietary supplements, my condition did not improve. At that time, I also had an irresistible desire for red meat, ”said Tami, who liked the burger she ate after decades of eating meat so much that vegetarianism became a thing of the past.


She takes good care of the animals at her farm. PHOTO: Instagram

“It took a while for me to start eating pork and poultry, but I couldn't resist the beef anymore, and I liked the lamb terribly and my health suddenly improved. It felt great as I gave my body what it needed, ”adds Tami. Despite interrupting her vegetarian diet, she was careful when choosing meat and always preferred locally grown, all the more so if she knew the husbandman personally. And since she grew up on a farm, one day she got the idea that she would have it herself. But pigs were a logical decision for me, because they are one of the animals that meat growers are the worst at, ”said Tami, who moved to the United States decades ago. My husband and I bought a small farm and began a holistic approach to animal husbandry, and, above all, they treat their animals ethically.
For 10 years Tami was a vegetarian.
“Many will say that killing can never be ethical, but I do not agree with that. To kill an animal that humans then eat is not unethical, but only if it has had a good life before, "says Tami, who not only raised the animals, she also became a butcher. She has been enjoying her farm for eight years and has never been tempted to return to vegetarianism.
